intro: Licania spicata, commonly known as the spicate licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Licania spicata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
